info.description:
The Selling Partner API for Pricing helps you programmatically retrieve product pricing and offer pricing information for Amazon Marketplace products.

For more information, refer to the [Product Pricing v2022-05-01 Use Case Guide](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/product-pricing-api-v2022-05-01-use-case-guide).
info.title: Selling Partner API for Pricing

post.description:
Returns the set of responses that correspond to the batched list of up to 40 requests defined in the request body. The response for each successful (HTTP status code 200) request in the set includes the computed listing price at or below which a seller can expect to become the featured offer (before applicable promotions). This is called the featured offer expected price (FOEP). Featured offer is not guaranteed because competing offers might change. Other offers might be featured based on factors such as fulfillment capabilities to a specific customer. The response to an unsuccessful request includes the available error text.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 0.033 | 1 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that are applied to the requested operation, when available. The preceding table contains the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may receive higher rate and burst values than those shown here. For more information, refer to [Usage Plans and Rate Limits](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api) in the Selling Partner API.

post.description:
Returns the competitive summary response, including featured buying options for the ASIN and `marketplaceId` combination.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 0.033 | 1 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that are applied to the requested operation, when available. The preceding table contains the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may receive higher rate and burst values than those shown here. For more information, refer to [Usage Plans and Rate Limits](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api) in the Selling Partner API.

403.description: Indicates access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The specified resource does not exist.

GetFeaturedOfferExpectedPriceBatchReques.description: The request body for the `getFeaturedOfferExpectedPriceBatch` operation.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceRequestList.description: A batched list of FOEP requests.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceRequest.description: An individual FOEP request for a particular SKU.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceRequestParams.description: The parameters for an individual request.

GetFeaturedOfferExpectedPriceBatchRespon.description: The response schema for the `getFeaturedOfferExpectedPriceBatch` operation.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceResponseList.description: A batched list of FOEP responses.

request.description: Use these request parameters to map the response back to the request.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceResponse.description: Schema for an individual FOEP response.

CompetitiveSummaryRequest.description: An individual `competitiveSummary` request for an ASIN and `marketplaceId`.

asin.description: The Amazon Standard Identification Number for the item.

includedData.description: The list of requested competitive pricing data for the product.

lowestPricedOffersInputs.description: The list of `lowestPricedOffersInput` parameters that are used to build `lowestPricedOffers` in the response. This attribute is only valid if `lowestPricedOffers` is requested in `includedData`

uri.description: The URI associated with the individual APIs that are called as part of the batch request. For `getCompetitiveSummary`, this is `/products/pricing/2022-05-01/items/competitiveSummary`.

CompetitiveSummaryIncludedData.description: The supported data types in the `getCompetitiveSummary` API.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Describes the current segmented featured offer information for the item.
Provides reference price points for the item, such as the Competitive Price Threshold.
The lowest-priced standard offers that are available for the item in the Amazon store.

LowestPricedOffersInput.description: The input required for building `LowestPricedOffers` data in the response.

itemCondition.description: The input parameter specifies the `itemCondition` of the offer that is requested for `LowestPricedOffers`. `New` is the default value for `itemCondition`.

offerType.description: The input parameter specifies the type of offers requested for `LowestPricedOffers`. This applies to `Consumer` and `Business` offers. `Consumer` is the default `offerType`.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: An offer that is available to all Amazon customers.

CompetitiveSummaryBatchResponse.description: The response schema for the `competitiveSummaryBatch` operation.

responses.description: The response list for the `competitiveSummaryBatch` operation.

CompetitiveSummaryResponseList.description: The response list for the `competitiveSummaryBatch` operation.

items.description: The response for the individual `competitiveSummary` request in the batch operation.

CompetitiveSummaryResponse.description: The response for the individual `competitiveSummary` request in the batch operation.

status.description: The HTTP status line associated with the response. For more information, refer to [RFC 2616](https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec6.html).

body.description: The `competitiveSummaryResponse` body for a requested ASIN and `marketplaceId`.

CompetitiveSummaryResponseBody.description: The `competitiveSummaryResponse` body for a requested ASIN and `marketplaceId`.

asin.description: The Amazon identifier for the item.

featuredBuyingOptions.description: A list of featured buying options for the specified ASIN `marketplaceId` combination.

lowestPricedOffers.description: A list of lowest priced offers for the specified ASIN `marketplaceId` combination.

referencePrices.description: A list of reference prices for the specified ASIN `marketplaceId` combination.

ReferencePrice.description: The reference price for the specified ASIN `marketplaceId` combination.

name.description: Reference price type (e.g., `CompetitivePriceThreshold`, `WasPrice`, `CompetitivePrice`). For definitions, see the [Product Pricing API Use Case Guide](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/product-pricing-api-v2022-05-01-use-case-guide).

price.description: The reference price for the ASIN `marketplaceId` combination.

FeaturedBuyingOption.description: Describes a featured buying option, which includes a list of segmented featured offers for a particular item condition.

buyingOptionType.description: The buying option type for the featured offer. `buyingOptionType` represents the buying options that a customer receives on the detail page, such as `B2B`, `Fresh`, and `Subscribe n Save`. `buyingOptionType` currently supports `NEW` as a value.

segmentedFeaturedOffers.description: A list of segmented featured offers for the current buying option type. A segment can be considered as a group of regional contexts that all have the same featured offer. A regional context is a combination of factors such as customer type, region, or postal code and buying option.

SegmentedFeaturedOffer.description: A product offer with segment information indicating where it's featured.

allOf.description: The list of segment information in which the offer is featured.

featuredOfferSegments.description: The list of segment information in which the offer is featured.

LowestPricedOffer.description: Describes the lowest priced offers for the specified item condition and offer type.

lowestPricedOffersInput.description: The filtering criteria that are used to retrieve the lowest priced offers that correspond to the `lowestPricedOffersInputs` request.

offers.description: A list of up to 20 lowest priced offers that match the criteria specified in `lowestPricedOffersInput`.

Offer.description: The offer data of a product.

sellerId.description: The seller identifier for the offer.

subCondition.description: The item subcondition of the offer.

fulfillmentType.description: The fulfillment type for the offer. Possible values are `AFN` (Amazon Fulfillment Network) and `MFN` (Merchant Fulfillment Network).

listingPrice.description: The offer buying price. This doesn't include shipping, points, or applicable promotions.

shippingOptions.description: A list of shipping options associated with this offer

points.description: The number of Amazon Points that are offered with the purchase of an item and the monetary value of these points. Note that the Points element is only returned in Japan (JP).

eligibility.description: Indicates whether the offer is an Amazon Prime offer.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Indicates that this offer has Amazon Prime eligibility in all regions within the marketplace.
Indicates that this offer has Amazon Prime eligibility in some (but not all) regions within the marketplace.
Indicates that this offer is not an Amazon Prime offer in any region within the marketplace.

ShippingOption.description: The shipping option available for the offer.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The estimated shipping cost of the product. Note that the shipping cost is not always available.

FeaturedOfferSegment.description: Describes the segment in which the offer is featured.

customerMembership.description: The customer membership type that makes up this segment

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Customers that are not Prime members.
Customers whose Prime membership status is unknown.

SegmentDetails.description: The details about the segment. The FeaturedOfferExpectedPrice API uses only the sampleLocation portion as input.

glanceViewWeightPercentage.description: The glance view weighted percentage for this segment, which is the glance views for this segment as a percentage of total glance views across all segments for the ASIN. A higher percentage indicates that more Amazon customers receive this offer as the Featured Offer.

sampleLocation.description: The representative location that features the offer for the segment.

SampleLocation.description: Information about a location. It uses a postal code to identify the location.

PostalCode.description: Postal code value with country code

Errors.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

errors.description: One or more unexpected errors occurred during the operation.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceResponseBody.description: The FOEP response data for a requested SKU.

offerIdentifier.description: Metadata that identifies the target offer for which the FOEP result data was computed.

featuredOfferExpectedPriceResults.description: The FOEP results for the requested target offer.

errors.description: The errors that occurred if the operation wasn't successful (HTTP status code non-200).

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceResultList.description: A list of FOEP results for the requested offer.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPriceResult.description: The FOEP result data for the requested offer.

resultStatus.description: The status of the FOEP computation. Possible values include `VALID_FOEP`, `NO_COMPETING_OFFER`, `OFFER_NOT_ELIGIBLE`, `OFFER_NOT_FOUND`, and `ASIN_NOT_ELIGIBLE`. Additional values might be added in the future.

competingFeaturedOffer.description: The offer that will likely be the featured offer if the target offer is priced above its FOEP. If the target offer is currently the featured offer, this property will be different than `currentFeaturedOffer`.

currentFeaturedOffer.description: The offer that is currently the featured offer. If the target offer is not currently featured, then this property will be equal to `competingFeaturedOffer`.

FeaturedOfferExpectedPrice.description: The item price at or below which the target offer may be featured.

listingPrice.description: A computed listing price at or below which a seller can expect to become the featured offer (before applicable promotions).

points.description: The number of Amazon Points that are offered with the purchase of an item and the monetary value of these points.

offerIdentifier.description: An offer identifier used to identify the merchant of the featured offer. Since this may not belong to the requester, the SKU field is omitted.

price.description: The current active price of the offer.

HttpHeaders.description: A mapping of additional HTTP headers to send or receive for an individual request within a batch.

HttpStatusLine.description: The HTTP status line associated with the response for an individual request within a batch. For more information, refer to [RFC 2616](https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec6.html).

HttpBody.description: Additional HTTP body information that is associated with an individual request within a batch.

HttpUri.description: The URI associated with the individual APIs that are called as part of the batch request.

HttpMethod.description: The HTTP method associated with an individual request within a batch.

BatchRequest.description: The common properties for individual requests within a batch.

uri.description: The URI associated with an individual request within a batch. For `FeaturedOfferExpectedPrice`, this is `/products/pricing/2022-05-01/offer/featuredOfferExpectedPrice`.

BatchResponse.description: The common properties for responses to individual requests within a batch.

OfferIdentifier.description: Identifies an offer from a particular seller for a specified ASIN.

sellerId.description: The seller identifier for the offer.

sku.description: The seller SKU of the item. This will only be present for the target offer, which belongs to the requesting seller.

asin.description: The Amazon identifier for the item.

fulfillmentType.description: The fulfillment type for the offer.

currencyCode.description: The currency code in ISO 4217 format.

MoneyType.description: Currency type and monetary value schema to demonstrate pricing information.

listingPrice.description: The listing price for the item, excluding any promotions.

shippingPrice.description: The shipping cost of the product. Note that the shipping cost is not always available.

points.description: The number of Amazon Points that are offered with the purchase of an item and the monetary value of these points.

Price.description: The schema for item's price information, including listing price, shipping price, and Amazon Points.

pointsMonetaryValue.description: The monetary value of the Amazon Points.

Points.description: The number of Amazon Points that are offered with the purchase of an item and the monetary value of these points.

FulfillmentType.description: Indicates whether the item is fulfilled by Amazon or by the seller (merchant).

MarketplaceId.description: The marketplace ID is the globally unique identifier of a marketplace. To find the ID for your marketplace, refer to [Marketplace IDs](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/marketplace-ids).

Sku.description: The seller SKU of the item.

Segment.description: Input segment for featured offer expected price. The segment contains the location information for which featured offer expected price is requested.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses that are returned when a request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.
